dreisoft.tresos.guidedconfig.api.gui.form
Class SWTTreeTable

java.lang.Object
  dreisoft.tresos.guidedconfig.api.gui.form.SWTTreeTable
All Implemented Interfaces:
dreisoft.tresos.guidedconfig.api.gui.form.internal.ISWTWidgetElement, ISWTWidget
public class SWTTreeTable
extends java.lang.Object
implements ISWTWidget, dreisoft.tresos.guidedconfig.api.gui.form.internal.ISWTWidgetElement

This standard widget represents a tree table. 

 SWTColumnDescription[] descs = new SWTColumnDescription[5];
 descs[0] = new SWTTreeColumnDescription(
     "Float",
     "MEMENTO1",
     TextFormat.TREE,
     100,
     "treeItem",
     new String[]{"myIcon.png"} );
 descs[1] = new SWTColumnDescription( "Integer", "MEMENTO2", TextFormat.INTEGER, 100, "2" );
 descs[2] = new SWTColumnDescription( "String", "MEMENTO3", TextFormat.TEXT, 100, "abc" );
 descs[3] = new SWTColumnDescription( "Boolean", "MEMENTO4", TextFormat.BOOLEAN, 100, "false" );
 descs[4] = new SWTColumnDescription( "Combo", "MEMENTO5", 100, new String[]{"ONE", "TWO", "THREE"}, null );
 
 factory.createTreeTable( parentComposite,
                          IConstants.WIDGET_ID_TREE,
                          IConstants.MEMENTO_KEY_TREE,
                          "My Tree",
                          10,
                          descs,
                          WidgetFactory.TREE_TABLE_ACTION_ALL );

Copyright (C) Elektrobit Automotive GmbH - All rights reserved

Since:
2009.a

Nested Class Summary
static class SWTTreeTable.ModelChange
          A ModelChange instance is used by the refresh(Collection) method to signal which rows have been change in the model in which way.
static class SWTTreeTable.ModelChangeType
          Descibes the type of a change used in SWTTreeTable.ModelChange.

TABLE_SHOW_READONLY_ROW_CONTENT

public static final int TABLE_SHOW_READONLY_ROW_CONTENT
Shows content of rows at a read-only level. By default, the content (except the tree column) is not shown at a read-only level.

expandRowToLevel

public void expandRowToLevel(java.lang.Object rowObject,
                             int depth)
Will expand the children to the given depth, but does not close already opened items. If rowObject is null all root-items will be expanded to the given level

Parameters:
rowObject - the Object or Element (may be null)
depth - the depth to expand to
Since:

refresh

public void refresh(java.util.Collection<SWTTreeTable.ModelChange> rowObjects)
Repaint the given rows of the tree.

Parameters:
rowObjects - object marking the rows (when operating on a mementos tree, these are the row mementos)
Since:
2009.a

getSelections

public java.lang.Object[] getSelections()

Returns:
the selected rows (not null)
Since:
2009.a

getSelectionParent

public java.lang.Object getSelectionParent()
Query the parent row object of the selected rows.

Returns:
the parent row object, null if the selection has no common parent or if all are root objects
Since:
2009.a

hasSameSelectionParent

public boolean hasSameSelectionParent()
Query if all selected rows have the same parent row.

Returns:
true if at least one row is selected and all selected rows have the same parent
Since:
2009.a

setSelection

public void setSelection(java.lang.Object[] rowObjects)
Set the specified row objects.

With the standard controller implementation the row objects are the tree row Mementos.

Parameters:
rowObjects - the rows (normally the row mementos) to select, null to select nothing
Since:
2009.a

setSelection

public void setSelection(Memento[] rows)
Select the given rows.

With the standard controller implementation the row objects are the tree row Mementos.

Parameters:
rows - the mementos that represent the rows

2009.a

isReadOnly

public boolean isReadOnly(java.lang.Object rowObject)
Query if a given row is readonly.

Parameters:
rowObject - the row object specifying the row that is in question
Returns:
true if row is readonly (should not be edited from the GUI)
Since:
2009.a

isStructureReadonly

public boolean isStructureReadonly(java.lang.Object rowObject)
Query if a given row does allows structural changes to its children.

Structural changes means adding, removing, moving... chilren.

Parameters:
rowObject - the row object specifying the row that is in question
Returns:
true if structural changes to the given row should not be allowed
Since:
2009.a

isParentStructureReadonly

public boolean isParentStructureReadonly(java.lang.Object rowObject)
Query if the parent of the given row does allow structural changes to its children.

Structural changes means adding, removing, moving... chilren.

Parameters:
rowObject - the selected row object
Returns:
true if structural changes to the parent row should not be allowed
Since:
2009.a

addDragSource

public org.eclipse.swt.dnd.DragSource addDragSource(int style,
                                                    org.eclipse.swt.dnd.Transfer[] transferAgents,
                                                    org.eclipse.swt.dnd.DragSourceListener sourceListener)
                                             throws dreisoft.tresos.guidedconfig.api.internal.GuidedConfigException
Creates a new DragSource to handle dragging from the TreeTable. It is only possible to create one DragSource for each TreeTable. The DragSource will be deleted when the widget is disposed.

Parameters:
style - the bitwise OR'ing of allowed operations; this may be a combination of any of DND.DROP_NONE, DND.DROP_COPY, DND.DROP_MOVE, DND.DROP_LINK
transferAgents - a list of Transfer objects which define the types of data that can be dragged from this source
sourceListener - the listener which should be notified
Returns:
the DragSource
Throws:
dreisoft.tresos.guidedconfig.api.internal.GuidedConfigException - for all problems adding a drag source. Use getCause() to retrieve more information about which problem occured.
Since:
12.0

addDropTarget

public org.eclipse.swt.dnd.DropTarget addDropTarget(int style,
                                                    org.eclipse.swt.dnd.Transfer[] transferAgents,
                                                    org.eclipse.swt.dnd.DropTargetListener dropListener)
                                             throws dreisoft.tresos.guidedconfig.api.internal.GuidedConfigException
Creates a new DropTarget to allow data to be dropped on the specified Control. It is only possible to create one DropTarget for each TreeTable. All DropTargets will be deleted when the widget is disposed.

Parameters:
style - the bitwise OR'ing of allowed operations; this may be a combination of any of DND.DROP_NONE, DND.DROP_COPY, DND.DROP_MOVE, DND.DROP_LINK
transferAgents - a list of Transfer objects which define the types of data that can be dropped on this target
dropListener - the listener which should be notified
Returns:
the DropTarget
Throws:
dreisoft.tresos.guidedconfig.api.internal.GuidedConfigException - for all problems adding a drop target. Use getCause() to retrieve more information about which problem occured.
Since:
12.0
